headline: U.S. Luxury Market Splits: Price Cuts Ignite Sales While Select Metros See Rapid Price Growth
summary: The U.S. luxury housing market is showing two distinct personalities, according to the October Realtor.com® Housing Market Luxury Report. While the national entry point for luxury softened, falling 2.2% year-over-year to $1.22 million, a deeper dive into metro trends reveals a split between local hotbeds of intense competition and markets where price corrections are effectively re-engaging buyers and boosting sales.
